remarks.para: May be inoperative deactivated closed provided:

numlitem.para: Equipment cooling system is operated with one fan deactivated,
Remaining fan is operative, and
For operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C) at least one pack is operating.

note.para: Forward cargo heating will not be available.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Ensure at least one pack is operating for operation on the ground above 85°F OAT (29°C).
If Supply Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG SUP FAN may remain annunciated.
If Exhaust Fan is deactivated, status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated.
Carriage of animals and perishables in forward cargo compartment is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to the Equipment Cooling selector "EQUIP COOLING EXH FAN INOP" or "EQUIP COOLING SUPPLY FAN INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: To deactivate the inboard exhaust valve closed, use either PROCEDURE A (with shorting plug) or PROCEDURE B (without shorting plug):

numlitem.para: PROCEDURE A (Deactivate Exhaust Fan and Close Inboard Exhaust Valve):
Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.

note.para: The shorting wire and plug in the following steps are UPS P/N 747-21-003-101, if available.

numlitem.para: Fabricate a 3 to 4 inch shorting wire from type 6A (BMS 13-60 Type 1 or BMS 13-48 Type 10) wire terminating with a P/N BACC47CN1A 24 AWG pin contact on one end and a 20 AWG pin contact on the other end, per the Standard Wiring Practices Manual.
Obtain shorting plug P/N BACC45FN14-15P and, using fabricated shorting wire, short pin numbers 5 & 6 on the shorting plug. Use the 20 AWG contact on pin 5 and the 24AWG contact on pin 6.
Gain access to inboard exhaust valve (AMM 21-58-23/401).
Disconnect electrical connector from Inboard Exhaust valve, located in the forward cargo floor at STA 560.
Install shorting plug, P/N BACC45N14-15P, with shorting wire attached on the electrical connector and stow.

note.para: The shorting wire is installed so EQUIP COOLING cautionary message and EE CLNG INBD EXH status message will not display due to the disable Inboard Exhaust Valve.

numlitem.para: Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Open and collar the P415 panel EQPT COOLING EXHAUST FAN circuit breaker.
Determine Inboard Exhaust Valve position. If not already closed, manually position valve in the closed position. (AMM 21-58-23/401)

note.para: Status message EE CLNG EXH FAN may remain annunciated.

numlitem.para: PROCEDURE B (Deactivate Supply Fan and Close Inboard Exhaust Valve):
Open the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Gain access to inboard exhaust valve (AMM 21-58-23/401).
Disconnect, cap, and stow electrical connector from Inboard Exhaust Valve located in the forward cargo floor area at STA 560.
Close the P414 panel EQUIP COOL CONT VLV INBD circuit breaker.
Open and collar the P414 panel EQPT COOLING SUPPLY FAN circuit breaker.

note.para: EE Cooling System will not provided adequate equipment cooling until the Inboard Exhaust Valve is closed. EICAS caution message EQUIP COOLING will be displayed and the ground crew call horn will sound if the following step is not accomplished within 30 seconds after opening the circuit breaker in step 5 above.

numlitem.para: Determine Inboard Exhaust Valve position. If not already closed, manually position valve in the closed position. (AMM 21-58-23/401)

note.para: Status message EE CLNG SUP FAN and EE CLNG INBD EXH may remain annunciated.
Temperature gradients are to be expected during these inoperative conditions. Predicted cargo compartment temperatures (which may vary) when forward cargo heat is inoperative:

entry.para: Ground operation – steady state temperatures with A/C Packs ON
